summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2020 between officials at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG). The correspondence concerns efforts by SDNY prosecutors, who have recently charged Ghislaine Maxwell, to locate and obtain hard-copy criminal files and documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL). The emails discuss points of contact, including the SDFL Criminal Chief, and coordination for a victim meeting.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the recently charged defendant by the SDNY prosecutors, which is the impetus for their renewed efforts to obtain documents from the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the prior investigation in SDFL; his death had previously mooted document requests from SDNY.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged in connection with Epstein's activities, as SDNY prosecutors seek documents from Epstein's prior case for her prosecution.
M., from ODAG, is assisting SDNY prosecutors in identifying the correct contacts in SDFL to obtain Epstein case files for the Maxwell prosecution.

events.title: SDNY Charges Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York brings charges against Ghislaine Maxwell, prompting renewed document requests related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Coordination for Victim Meeting
events.description: An ODAG official informs SDNY prosecutors that plans for a victim meeting are being finalized.

events.title: OPR Document Collection
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) conducted a significant document collection related to the Epstein case the prior year.

keyFacts: SDNY prosecutors, after charging Ghislaine Maxwell, are actively seeking hard-copy criminal files from the Southern District of Florida related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) is facilitating contact, directing SDNY to the Criminal Chief of the SDFL for assistance in locating files.
A victim meeting related to the case was being planned as of August 2020.
The prior death of Jeffrey Epstein in 2019 had initially mooted SDNY's document requests, but the Maxwell charges revived the need.
The correspondence reveals inter-district coordination within the DOJ to handle evidence and discovery for the Maxwell prosecution.
